IncomingMessages: An off-world command priority has stalled all processes within this installation. The terminal blinks angrily with a demand for urgent action on an unpaid debt.
Gek Trade Federation fury! Planetary installation tax unpaid! Initiate repayment!
There is an option to reply with currency attached. I get the impression someone's life would get a lot easier if I'm feeling charitable...

Options.Name: Pay full amount
Options.Text:
A remotely-operated scent dispersal system bathes me in a pleasant perfume.

The terminal unlocks something that will aid my travels.

Options.Name: Pay partial amount
Options.Text:
An angry alien beak momentarily appears on a terminal and shouts at me.

Limited systems within the facility are back online.

IncomingMessages: Images of fighter-class starships have been sent here. They bare scorch-marks from battle, and are most likely pirates.
Gek Trade Federation warning. Pirate activity detected. Report sightings!
The message seems to ask for witnesses, and there's some form of reward for replies...

Options.Name: Tag some ships
Options.Text: An instant reply comes through with a small monetary reward!

Options.Name: Tag all ships
Options.Text: A worried response comes through with a reward for my report.

IncomingMessages: A mass-mailed corporate message sits unread on the terminal. It is full of high numbers and seemingly impressive profit margins. The tone seems satisfied, and grateful.
Friend! Gek Trade Federation announces high profit! Choose units or product recipe reward!
At its foot the employee can choose between one of two images: a galactic unit banking account, or a full hold of cargo.

Options.Name: Choose unit account
Options.Text:
An automatic scent dispenser sprays me with a pleasant perfume when it opens.

I receive funds from the message's senders.

Options.Name: Choose ship's cargo
Options.Text: I retrieve a formula from the operational facility.

IncomingMessages: There is a message from a distant alien race. They sound angry with the trader who's logged into the system.
Scurrilous Gek Trader! Gek offer impure matter! Vy'keen destroy Gek! Units withheld!
I can send them one of two on-screen metallic products. The first looks oddly faint in colour, and the second shimmers brightly on-screen.

Options.Name: Send faintly-coloured metal
Options.Text:
The voice of an angry warrior screams through the intercom. 

Nothing else happens.

Options.Name: Send brightly-coloured metal
Options.Text:
A noise of gruff acceptance is heard over the intercom.

A payment is released.

IncomingMessages: The screen shows that a lot of elements are exchanged here, but right now the trading vault is open... and empty.
Friend! Gek Trade Federation demand uncommon metal elements! High units offer!
An off-world message, perhaps related to this, flashes on-screen.

Options.Name: Put common metal into trading vault
Options.Text: I receive a small payment.

Options.Name: Put uncommon metal into trading vault
Options.Text: I receive a generous payment.

Options.Name: Put rare metal into trading vault
Options.Text:
I receive a decent payment...

... and a surprised note of thanks.

IncomingMessages: This is a brand new manufacturing plant with no assigned specialty. The terminal is entirely blank, and is running automated start-up procedures. I have to flick through several screens before a pictorial message appears.
Trade federation friend! Product recipe unselected! Gek Trade Federation lose units!
There are three chemical symbols – one a catalyst, and the others organic and metallic . Production processes warm up around me, waiting for a template to work from.

Options.Name: Choose the catalyst
Options.Text: The terminal processes my selection, and provides something appropriate to the work at hand...

Options.Name: Choose the metal
Options.Text: The terminal processes my selection, and provides something appropriate to the work at hand...

Options.Name: Choose the organic compound
Options.Text: The terminal processes my selection, and provides something appropriate to the work at hand...

IncomingMessages: The trade vaults in this installation are full to the brim, and ready for distribution. There are three images on-screen, each showing the outline of a different sort of trader. It's strange... it's as if they're put in order of the size of their gut.
Rejoice! Vy'keen war reparations arrive! Elder large Gek receive high reward! Low toilgek receive low reward!
The first trader is small and sleek, the second is pudgier – and the final has a huge belly that almost drags on the floor. I'm clearly meant to choose one...

Options.Name: Choose the small, sleek trader
Options.Text:
A trade vault opens.

I receive a cursory amount of trade goods .

Options.Name: Choose the medium-sized trader
Options.Text:
A trade vault opens

I receive a decent amount of trade goods.

Options.Name: Choose the obese trader
Options.Text: I retrieve a strange alien curio from the facility.

IncomingMessages: An important message has been received from off-world. A holographic overlay shows various interstellar trade routes, but each one ends abruptly – long before their destination is reached.
Gek Trade Federation warning! Vy'keen hostility? Captain! Complete trade mission, or investigate disappearance?
There are goods waiting in a locked trade vault for transportation. I can select the final destination, or I can select one of points at which a ship has disappeared.

Options.Name: Select trading destination
Options.Text: The trade vault unlocks.

Options.Name: Select disappearance location
Options.Text: I receive a ship technology blueprint to aid in my protection.

IncomingMessages: This whole facility beams out some kind of suppression field over the planet's surface. It's dampening some unknown form of communication, and clearly seen as a vital and necessary operation by the traders that operate here.
Despair! First spawn monolith awake! Unknown culprit! Strengthen suppression field!
The suppression field is powered by catalytic elements, fed into the system by the unlocked resource vault that's at my feet.

Options.Name: Remove catalyst
Options.Text:
I take the trade goods.

The suppression field powers down.

Options.Name: Add catalyst
Options.Text:
The suppression field is strengthened.

A message of relief appears on-screen.

IncomingMessages: A trade vault shakes, and closer inspection reveals that it's full of writhing molluscs. They are pink and slug-like, with sharp bloodied teeth.
Rare balarian speech slug distribution point! For insertion in ear! Inedible! Nasal insertion can cause death.
A diagram on the screen in front of me suggests that inserting one in or around my face would have some benefits. What isn't specified, however, is which orifice.

Options.Name: Insert slug in nose
Options.Text:
The slug bites flesh from my nose.

The pain is extreme.

Options.Name: Insert slug in ear
Options.Text:
The slug burrows deep into my ear.

I feel better versed in the language of the traders.

Options.Name: Insert slug in mouth
Options.Text:
I swallow the slug, and wait while it thrashes around in my stomach.

Nothing else of note occurs.

IncomingMessages: A strange test is visible on the terminal. A resident Trader has left a note for a colleague.
Friend! SynthetiGek identification test active! Remember Gek Trader helps customers!

I see a holographic image of a shell-wearing creature lying on its back in the bright glare of the sun. Try as it might, it cannot right itself. I can manipulate the scene to indicate what I would do to help.

Options.Name: Help creature, then sell it water
Options.Text:
I pass the test, proving myself as a true trader.

Facility systems are online.

Options.Name: Study creature
Options.Text:
I fail the test.

Facility systems are non-operational.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is abandoned, its alarms still blaring a warning to souls long-dead.

The Gek used this installation to plan asymmetric wars against the other species of the galaxy. This faction would bolster rogue elements within other star systems, routing the resulting tithes and protection fees through this outpost.

The last log shows potential Vy'keen traitors en-route to discuss terms with the Gek. What happened to them is unclear.
TRA_HARV_LANG_14

Options.Name: Alert the Gek
Options.Text: I alert the Gek Trade Federation to the Vy'keen activity in this system, broadcasting this feed to their central computers. A representative rewards me for my trouble.

Options.Name: Alert the Vy'keen
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen to the presence of traitors in this system, uploading a great deal of Gek data upon request. They reward me for my assistance.

Options.Name: Steal units
Options.Text: I steal units from the system, the blood money of a hundred wars and skirmishes. After all, the Gek here no longer have need of it...

IncomingMessages:
The facility contains multiple video files, images, and bioscans of unusual beings taken by Gek from across the Trade Federation. They seem to have been studying exosuits.

Something happened during the experiment, a dormant prototype of such a suit lying in wait below. Nothing else remains.
TRA_HARV_LANG_15

Options.Name: Submit bioscan
Options.Text:
I submit a bioscan to the system, apparently restarting the facility's production process. With the missing piece complete, a suit is fabricated to the exact specifications of my own.
An automated message rewards me for my assistance.

Options.Name: Erase data
Options.Text: I erase the data on the Gek computers. They were not meant to learn our technology. In the process, I find a cluster of nanites, useful for my own purposes.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I steal nanite clusters from the system, leaving the rest of the facility in peace.

IncomingMessages:
The facility acted as a staging ground for what appears to have been an unprovoked Gek attack against something called an 'Atlas Interface'.

The logs show that a great deal of material was harvested from the oceans of many worlds. This substance was cross-referenced against data stolen from other species, and then field-tested against this Atlas structure.

The interface was utterly annihilated, as were the attackers. The blast seems to have wiped five star systems from existence. Only this record remains.
TRA_HARV_LANG_16

Options.Name: Delete records
Options.Text:
I delete the records from the system. No-one should replicate what happened here.
In the process, I find some useful technology used in the construction of the weapon. It should be safe to use in isolation from the other components.

Options.Name: Alert Gek Trade Federation
Options.Text:
I alert the Gek Trade Federation to the results of this experiment. They deny all knowledge of it, claiming it to be the work of heretics.
I am rewarded for my future silence.

Options.Name: Alert other species
Options.Text:
I alert both Vy'keen and Korvax authorities to the Gek attack on the Atlas Interface and their data theft. Outraged, both species demand an immediate Council to discuss their next move.
I am rewarded for my assistance.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is ancient, even by the standards of the Gek. Its environment is specifically calibrated for data preservation.

One log speaks of the time just before the rise of the 'Gek First Spawn'. The Gek seem to have experienced a fertility crisis. Something in the water began to affect their spawning numbers, leading to an attempts at selective breeding, cloning programmes, and more.

This scientific crisis became a moral one. The self-proclaimed 'First Spawn' took power, promising greatness and murdering all those who opposed them. Memories of the past were erased. To be strong was to be righteous.
TRA_HARV_LANG_17

Options.Name: Upload to Gek
Options.Text:
I upload the data to the Gek. The traders are astounded by my discovery, having believed themselves to be the descendents of a savage people, not knowing that before the First Spawn they were gentle, capable of nobility and peace.
I am rewarded greatly for what I have done.

Options.Name: Auction data
Options.Text:
I auction the data, finding a buyer in the Korvax. Their Convergence desires all the information it can find about the Gek, having been enslaved by these 'First Spawn' many years ago.
They pay me for my assistance.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I steal what little technology I can from the outpost, harvesting nanite clusters from the system.

IncomingMessages:
The facility contains records of temporal anomalies and reported sightings of time travellers. The majority of these appear to be Gek or Korvax, often bearing advanced technology.

The chief scientist's log reveals a great deal of scepticism, deeming such travel not only physically impossible but unlikely from a social perspective. If time travellers exist, why do they change nothing? Why do they not attempt to avert the catastrophe of which they speak?

The final log shows the arrival of the scientist's superiors, confiscating their files and silencing them.
TRA_HARV_LANG_18

Options.Name: Attempt data recovery
Options.Text:
I attempt to recover data from the system, but I find only small fragments of data.

The majority of time travellers appear to have visited loved ones or parents, claiming they wanted to see them one last time before the end. There appears to be no great secret beyond this.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: I extract nanite clusters from the system, attached to the remnants of a case file.

Options.Name: Contact Gek
Options.Text:
I contact the Gek to ask them about this facility, but they claim to have no knowledge of it. They begin to display an extraordinary level of interest in my whereabouts, suggesting they will send a nearby freighter to speak with me.

I should leave soon.

IncomingMessages:
This installation appears to have been staffed by an old SalesGek, a veteran of a hundred trade routes and 'personal friend' to one of the Trade Lords themselves.

Estranged from their consort, their hundred surviving spawn no longer wishing to speak to them, the SalesGek had one final meal before their death, crashing their ship into the side of a nearby ridge. They leave behind a life of regret and a litany of unanswered invoices and receipts. Perhaps there is something useful here.
I am sorry, friends, family... I am sorry...

Options.Name: Report death
Options.Text: I report the death of the SalesGek. The Trade Federation thanks me, struggling to find their name on any system. It appears they had not made a deal of note in many years. I am given a small reward.

Options.Name: Search for units
Options.Text: I search for units, but find none. The SalesGek was in a deep amount of debt before their death. I leave, empty-handed.

Options.Name: Sell trade data
Options.Text: I sell the trade data to another SalesGek. They will no doubt find something of worth in this lifeform's death.

IncomingMessages:
This Gek outpost acted as a point of exchange for replacement ship and space station components.

All of the blueprints are at best adapted, at worst stolen, from the technology of other species. There are a number of such designs available upon the terminal's screen.
TRA_HARV_LANG_20

Options.Name: Download data
Options.Text: I download the terminal's data, finding nanites I may exchange for a new technology.

Options.Name: Sell data
Options.Text: I sell the data to a rival trade faction. They immediately lodge a complaint with the Trade Federation whilst secretly utilising these designs for their own production.

Options.Name: Report theft
Options.Text: I report the theft of these technologies to both the Korvax and the Vy'keen. I receive compensation for my trouble, leaving both species to withdraw their diplomats in protest against the Gek.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal, but something deep within the complex is malfunctioning. Surfaces feel hot to the touch, hidden machinery clanks and whirrs. An alert sounds:
Warning! High temperature! Warning! High temperature!
The alarm rings in my ears. A bead of sweat rolls slowly down my forehead.

Options.Name: Engage coolant chamber network
Options.Text: Numbers on the terminal display begin to stabilise, red flashing symbols morphing into a calming blue array of light.

Options.Name: Activate fusion dampening field
Options.Text: Activating the fusion dampening causes a power surge. The terminal shorts and cuts out. The system no longer responds to my commands.

Options.Name: Initialize laser refraction systems
Options.Text: Numbers on the screen in front of me rise rapidly as I activate the laser array. I feel a dramatic surge of heat through the terminal, before the entire system shuts down.

IncomingMessages: The control terminal before me appears to be for some sort of deep-level mining system. However, all systems have stalled. The screen flashes a readout:
Mining production stalled! Low power! Low fuel! Organic matter required!
Warning lights blink on and off. A material hopper opens.

Options.Name: Insert carbon
Options.Text: Lights flicker across the facility. Machinery rumbles deep beneath my feet as the drill motor whirrs into life. The facility is back online.

Options.Name: Insert ferrite dust
Options.Text: The ferrite slips down the material hopper, but the choking, grinding sound that follows does not sound positive. The machinery shuts down completely.I fear I have flooded important internal components with metallic dust.

Options.Name: Insert hand
Options.Text: Metallic gears grab at my fingers. Sparks fly from my Exosuit gloves, shorting the terminal. I pull my hand back sharply as the hopper slams shut.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost has gone into emergency lockdown. Something must have been damaged during my entry.
The toxicity gauge on my Exosuit flickers as an alert flashes insistently on the control terminal.
High gas pressure! Breach detected! Pressure critical!
The alarms on the panel flash rapidly, demanding attention. A bewildering array of control gauges sit before me.

Options.Name: Activate emergency vent
Options.Text: A low rumble passes underneath my feet as I activate the emergency vent. Slowly but surely the indicators on the panel start to stabilise and the warning lights soften. The facility comes back online.

Options.Name: Increase gas pressure
Options.Text: The alarms blink with increased intensity.A pipe ruptures, venting toxic gas directly into the facility!

Options.Name: Flush coolant
Options.Text: Pipes under the floor gurgle and hiss as I twist the coolant valve. A sudden burst of steam erupts from the panel, destroying the instruments.

IncomingMessages: Strange symbols pulse urgently on the terminal display. The flashing lights and loud siren appear to relate to the facility's nuclear power core. A message prints out on the display.
Fusion critical! Initiate emergency radiation dampening measures!
The automated safety systems have failed. Something must have been damaged as I entered the facility.

Options.Name: Activate radiation dampening field
Options.Text: The wail of the alarm system fades and the temperature readings slowly decay back to normal levels. Disaster has been averted, and the facility's production line returns to normal.

Options.Name: Initiate shutdown
Options.Text: Activating the emergency shudown procedure calms the wail of the sirens. Lights on the terminal flicker and die,  and the facility's machinery has fallen silent, but at least nothing has exploded.

Options.Name: Panic
Options.Text:
While I panic, the facility's fusion core overwhelms its dampening system and goes into meltdown.
A backup system prevents the total destruction of the facility, but the terminal is critically damaged.

Options.Name: Leave
Options.Text:
As I turn to leave, the facility's fusion core overwhelms its dampening system and goes into meltdown.
A backup system prevents the total destruction of the facility, but the terminal is critically damaged.

IncomingMessages: The facility remains operational despite my intrusion. This terminal appears to control the central production line. A readout on the display displays a status warning:
Warning! Increase metal delivery! Warning! Excess usage creates breach!
A large dial features prominently under the readout. It appears to control the system's material inputs.

Options.Name: Maintain levels
Options.Text: The system struggles on, producing a small number of components. Gradually the hoppers empty, and production grinds to a halt. The terminal shuts down, unpowered.

Options.Name: Increase levels
Options.Text: The warnings cease, and the system maintains its production. The increased pressure has kept the fabricators whirring and the facility at full power.

Options.Name: Dramatically increase levels
Options.Text: I hear hydraulic systems activate as hoppers open all over the facility, flooding the fabricators with raw material. Gears grind and pipes strain against the sudden abundance. With a loud crash, the system overloads.  Production comes to a total halt.

IncomingMessages: The alarms blares, and the terminal in front of me is scrambled. Through the flickering of the corrupted display I can just about make out a message:
Warning! Magnetic coil overcharged! Production low!
I feel heavy. My Multi-Tool pulls me down, and my helmet forces itself into my shoulders. It's not just me impacted. Production processes are going haywire...

Options.Name: Reboot gravitational stabilisers
Options.Text:
I feel a strange sensation deep within my brain as gravity momentarily destabilises. The electromagnetic stablisers in my Exosuit prevent any more dramatic effects.
However, power has not been restored to the terminal. If anything, it has only suffered more damage. The facility remains inoperable.

Options.Name: Reduce electromagnetic flow
Options.Text: A slow shiver pulses through my body as the powerful electromagnetic wave sweeps across the facility. Almost immediately, the terminal screen clears up. The production facility is back online.

Options.Name: Power down facility
Options.Text:
I throw the master power switch that sits alongside the terminal. The facility powers down. I reset the switch, and hope...
It does not power back up again.

IncomingMessages: The wail of an alarm fills my ears, but the system is not reacting to my intrusion. Someone else has been here and modified this terminal before. I struggle to decipher the data on the terminal.
Warning! Unexpected system detected! Bypass chip template detected! Gek Trade Federation informed!
Whatever code has been loaded on the terminal is clearly the work of some enterprising thief. It appears to be emptying the resource vaults of rare metals.

Options.Name: Revert system
Options.Text: I reset the system back to its default production loadout. Things appear to be operating as expected.

Options.Name: Attempt further hijack
Options.Text: I attempt to perform my own hijack of the terminal. It reroutes some of the automated profit flows directly to my account. However, my intrusion is clearly not subtle enough. Anti-tampering systems react and lock me out of the terminal.

IncomingMessages: Despite the warnings sounding out across the facility, the terminal remains open and ready for commerce. A brief introductory message blinks on the screen.
Friend! Know language, know commerce! Units buy knowledge! Choose Vy'keen, choose Korvax or choose a refresher in the language of the benevolent Gek!
Three columns of words endlessly scroll on-screen, each in a strange alphabet. Bloodied runes scratched in sand, a precise sequences of dots, and a hand-written font full of exclamatory punctuation.

Options.Name: Select bloodied runes
Options.Text: As I scan the runes, I feel a deep-seated roar rattle around my mind. A word sears itself into my brain, the language of a distant warrior race.

Options.Name: Select dot patterns
Options.Text: The dots race across the screen, an elegant, dancing pattern. I settle into the rhythm, and suddenly feel a burst of comprehension.A word sears itself into my brain. I feel altered by the process.

Options.Name: Select handwritten font
Options.Text: I feel a chittering glee as I scan the words the terminal presents. My other senses are affected, and I feel almost as if I could smell the language. Suddenly, a word sears itself into my brain, a fragment of Gek speech.

IncomingMessages: Alarms echo across the facility, a warning against my intrusion. Such an alert does not appear to slow down the commercial needs of the Gek, however. A nearby trade-ship is hailing the facility, looking for goods.
Gek Trade Federation dispatch! Planetary metal demand high! Collection ship imminent!
Perhaps if I were to offer goods of my own, I might both turn a profit and avoid alerting the Gek that there is an intruder in their facility...

Options.Name: Trade sodium
Options.Text: A relieved beaked trader shouts their thanks through the speaker systems. The success of the transaction appears to convince the security systems that I am a legitimate user.

Options.Name: Trade ferrite
Options.Text: The terminal shuts down rapidly. I can only assume my reply gave me away, and the trader alerted the authorities to my intrusion.

Options.Name: Trade carbon
Options.Text: The terminal shuts down rapidly. I can only assume my reply gave me away, and the trader alerted the authorities to my intrusion.

IncomingMessages: My dramatic entry appears to have caused a fire alert. The screen is wet to the touch. A warning flashes on the terminal:
Warning! Resource vault flooded! Production system operation forbidden!
Panels in the ceiling drip where a sprinkler system has been engaged. I can only hope the liquid is water.

Options.Name: Drain capacitor banks
Options.Text: The system sputters a little, showing signs of life. But it is not to be - a shower of sparks reveals a short-circuit within the flooded terminal. It closes down, the facility lifeless.

Options.Name: Drain resource vault
Options.Text:
The drained resource vault feeds rare elements into the production system.

The facility is back online.

Options.Name: Drain replication tank
Options.Text: Despite a dramatic gurgling from beneath my feet, the facility remains offline. The terminal, fatally damaged, shorts out.

IncomingMessages: I open the terminal, looking for a way to shut off the alarm. Primary access appears to be via some sort of hand scanner.

Options.Name: Scan hand
Options.Text:
I place my Exosuit glove upon the indent.
Without warning, a thousand tiny needles shoot out of the reader, meshing my hand to the machine. A synthetic voice speaks to me.

IncomingMessages: The alarm has rebooted the facility. An automated start-up routine is running. The terminal flashes text at me, clearly expecting some input.
Warning! Product recipe unselected! Assign recipe! Gek Trade Federation lose units!
A 3D interface waits in front of me, awaiting a blueprint for the facility to mass-produce. Machines around me hum as they warm up...

Options.Name: Sketch starship components
Options.Text: The terminal accepts my design and the installation start-up procedure completes. I hope the Gek who run this facility are happy with my choice.

Options.Name: Sketch synthetic plants
Options.Text: The terminal accepts my design and the installation start-up procedure completes. The Gek who run this facility may appreciate the extra green in their environment.

Options.Name: Sketch confectionery
Options.Text: The terminal accepts my design and the installation start-up procedure completes. I hope the Gek who run this facility are happy with their vast pile of sugar.

IncomingMessages: The facility's machinery lies still, halted by the emergency shutdown. A short message blinks on the control terminal.
User warning! Production disengaged. Restart generator empty. No fuel. Facility restart requires organic fuel.
A heavy circuit control switch sits invitingly above a fuel hopper, but a nearby dial shows that the tank is empty.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text:
I feed the fuel tank with a catalyst, hoping to boost the effect of whatever material powers this facility.
I throw the switch.  A low rumble is followed by a loud explosion deep within the facility. The terminal immediately cuts out.

Options.Name: Insert metals
Options.Text:
I feed a large amount of ferrite dust into the system's fuel supply. The pipes become sticky and choked, the dust mixing with the residue of other fuels.
I throw the switch, but to no avail. The generator system splurts and coughs before shutting down completely.

Options.Name: Insert organic elements
Options.Text:
The carbon-based fuel slips down the hopper's metal throat. I hear a gurgle as it feeds into the generator system.
I throw the switch.  The generator ticks over, then roars into life. The surge of power from the generator triggers the facility's main reactor, and the machinery comes back online.

IncomingMessages: An unknown fault has forced the whole system offline. There is a strange chill in the air, a sharp clarity to the atmosphere.
Alert! Alert! Liquid frenium leak! Charge cylinders frozen! Increase temperature!
I exhale as I ponder the words on the terminal. Condensation begins to cloud my visor.

Options.Name: Activate incineration banks
Options.Text: Warmth spreads through the facility. The air around me remains strange to look at, but the production systems return online.

Options.Name: Supercharge coolant flow
Options.Text: The system remains frozen. If anything, the air around me becomes even icier. Strange crystals frost over the surface of the terminal as it shuts down.

Options.Name: Initialise charge cylinder sequence
Options.Text: The noise of muffled explosions can be heard beneath my feet. The facility does become rapidly warmer, but all systems shut down dramatically.

IncomingMessages: Emergency measures have been initialised. The timestamp on the terminal's error reporting display shows that the incident occured long before my intrusion.
Electrolyte acidity test positive! Acidity slug detected! Release alkaline neutrality fluid into solution tank!
A recent scan shows a small alien lifeform crushed in the machinery below. Equipment all round it has corroded.

Options.Name: Neutralise electrolyte solution
Options.Text:
There is a hiss as the alkaline solution floods the facility's pipes. Machinery strains, trying to break free of the blockage in the gears.
With an unsettling snap, the production facility comes back online. The remains of the lifeform must have been washed free of the mechanisms.

Options.Name: Acidify heridium tanks
Options.Text: The air takes on a curious acidic tang. Fragile wires in the terminal corrode rapidly. The display shorts out, and then shuts down entirely.

Options.Name: Release suspension fluid
Options.Text: A frenzied chemical reaction can be heard somewhere beneath my feet. The terminal - and the rest of the facility - shuts down entirely.

IncomingMessages: The terminal barks a repeated warning. Though the words are unclear, the symbol is instantly recognisable. Something, somewhere in the facility is on fire.
Resource vault fire detected! Element stockpile destroyed!
A faint smoke begins to rise, and my scanner registers a steadily increasing temperature.

Options.Name: Starve production chamber of oxygen
Options.Text:
I hear a hiss as the air drains from the machinery chambers beneath my feet. The heat levels remain steady, however.
The control terminal enters an automated shutdown.

Options.Name: Starve resource vaults of oxygen
Options.Text:
I hear a hiss as the air drains from the resource vaults beneath my feet. Slowly but surely the heat levels start to drop. The fire is under control.
Enough remains in the vault that I should be able to restore the facility to operational status.

Options.Name: Initialise facility sprinkler system
Options.Text: The facility sprinkler showers above my head. It has no impact on the internal fire, but does short out the control terminal.

IncomingMessages: My entry has caused the facility to go into immediate lockdown, interrupting its operation. Visual readouts on the terminal indicate that this is a deep-level mining facility. Its resource vaults are emptying rapidly.
Drilling error! Elements drain into planet core! Reverse tunnel pressure!
The facility map shows flashing errors over both the resource collection vaults and the drill array...

Options.Name: Collapse drill tunnel
Options.Text: I hear a deep, distant noise, a subterranean roll of thunder. The resource vaults empty entirely, drained into the earth. The facility remains offline.

Options.Name: Retract drilling rig
Options.Text: The drilling rig retracts from the shaft, but this only seems to accelerate the loss of material. The dials spin furiously before settling. The resource vaults are empty, drained into the earth. The facility remains offline.

Options.Name: Reverse tunnel pressurisation
Options.Text: I hear a deep, distant noise, a subterranean roll of thunder. Slowly the resource vaults beneath the surface stop spilling their contents into the earth, and eventually begin to refill. The facility comes back online.

IncomingMessages: The factory recycles bundles of clothing and other materials harvested throughout the galaxy, spitting out new items for Gek exosuits.
SENSORS REPORT INORGANIC BLOCKAGE IN SECTOR 9A

Amidst the detritus of the production line, the body of a Korvax scientist appears to drift, their lights disabled, their limbs completely motionless. The factory's systems allow outbound communication. Numerous options are available.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I report what I have seen to the Vy'keen. The warriors are outraged, claiming that the Gek have returned to their genocidal ways.
They promise to dispatch warships at once.

Options.Name: Report to Gek
Options.Text:
I report what I have seen to the Gek. They claim that this is a terrible mistake, and that the perpetrators will of course be punished.
They send through a generous reward for my altruism and my silence.

Options.Name: Report to Korvax
Options.Text:
I report what I have seen to the Korvax. They tell me that the carapace in question is empty, its soul returned to their Convergence.
They will dispatch a ship to bring the body home, claiming that it is of sentimental value to its previous owner. They thank me.

IncomingMessages:
The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them with the resources available on this world.

This installation creates parts for Gek trade vessels. They are designed to hold the maximum possible cargo whilst protecting against Sentinel and pirate attacks.
QA SYSTEM FULLY ONLINE... ALL COMPONENTS LOGGED... LOG FULLY COMPLIANT...
The terminal shows a video feed of the factory's depths. A group of Gek appear to be removing key components from each ship.

Options.Name: Alert Gek Trade Federation
Options.Text:
I alert the Gek Trade Federation to potential criminal activity, broadcasting this feed to their central computers.
A representative rewards me for my trouble.

Options.Name: Demand bribe from Gek
Options.Text: I demand a bribe from the Gek in exchange for concealing their criminal activities. Reluctantly, they agree.

Options.Name: Ask what they are doing
Options.Text: I ask what the Gek are doing down there. They turn immediately to the source of the audio, firing at it and disabling my video feed. By the time the system repairs itself, they are gone.

IncomingMessages: As I approach the terminal, it is clear that something terrible has happened in this place. The facility produces items and labels them 'Gek Relics', supposedly granting luck to their bearers.
The glass - it - we were wrong... we were -

The video feed shows strands of Nanite Clusters overrunning the facility's depth. Bulbous green masses extending from a great deal of the machinery, teeth sprouting from within. A voice cries out in an unknown tongue.

Options.Name: Take Nanite Clusters
Options.Text: I take the Nanite Clusters, and the mass immediately collapses. It wishes to go with me, I am sure of it...

Options.Name: Report Production Failure
Options.Text:
I report a production failure. Gek authorities tell me to remain here and await quarantine.
But I think I should leave. I take some Nanites with me as I go. They want to escape...

Options.Name: Take Gek Relics
Options.Text: I take some Gek Charms. I feel luckier already. The probability of the entire universe is turned in favour of my survival.

IncomingMessages: The terminal displays the logs of numerous financial transactions and trade deals conducted from this facility over the last few months.

Readouts show layouts of multiple Vy'keen and Korvax factories. The Gek overseers of this installation were attempting to discover how these other species conceal their buildings from Sentinel attacks.

No-one remains. The last life sign here was terminated three days ago.

Options.Name: Report to Gek
Options.Text: I report the situation to the Gek. The Trade Federation thanks me for the report, dispatching multiple ships to ensure the facility's destruction.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen
Options.Text: I report the situation to the Vy'keen. Their High Command is outraged at the attempted theft of their technology, promising to commit acts of retribution against the Gek.

Options.Name: Report to Korvax
Options.Text: I report the situation to the Korvax. Their Convergence is troubled by the deaths of so many Gek, claiming that they will mourn them. They have nothing else to say.

IncomingMessages: The installation crackles with blue sparks, electricity arcing from panel to panel across the machines.
ALERT TIME DISPLACEMENT ALERT

The terminal shows the time and date appearing to flip back and forth, advancing into the future and retreating into the past. Sensors indicate something called a white hole has been activated within the factory's heart.

Options.Name: Alert FutureGek
Options.Text:
Nothing happens for a few moments... or perhaps it is hours. Perhaps an entire year passes.

The temporal event ceases, and I am left with a gift, rewarded by these 'FutureGek' for my assistance.

Options.Name: Activate Chronal Trigger
Options.Text:
Nothing happens for a few moments... or perhaps it is hours. Perhaps an entire year passes.

The temporal event ceases, and I am left with blueprints for new technology, apparently created by a future version of my own self. I do not know what this Chronal Trigger has brought into being.

Options.Name: Obey
Options.Text:
Nothing happens for a few moments... or perhaps it is hours. Perhaps an entire year passes.

The temporal event ceases, and I am left with a gift, rewarded by the crimson light of an unseen being.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal, but the readout is confusing, garbled...
The Senate has fallen. Already the purge begins... truth is denied. The Gek protocol ends...
The factory appears to produce literature. Not machines, not files, but paper, covered in a handwritten font full of exclamatory punctuation.

Options.Name: Shut down production
Options.Text:
I shut down production. The printing press ceases operation, perhaps for the final time. How many others exist like this, I wonder?

Amidst the detritus of the factory, I find some discarded technology. Perhaps it will be of use.

Options.Name: Report to Gek authorities
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Gek authorities. They claim that the installation has nothing to do with me, paying me dearly for my silence.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I attempt to steal technology, but the factory's automated defense systems blast a bolt of energy at my suit instead. Whatever is here, it is not worth the trouble.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces everyday implements for the Gek. Eating utensils for their meals, spray to keep their skin from drying out in alien atmospheres, pheromone bottles, and so forth.
SYSTEMS OPERATIONAL... SELECTED DESIRED PRODUCT...
The facility is abandoned, but there is no obvious reason for an alarm to be going off. Everything seems fine.

Options.Name: Search for technology
Options.Text:
I search for technology within the factory's computers and find a large number of nanite clusters.

As I go, I hear it, a voice in the darkness. I investigate, but there is nothing there...

Options.Name: Report to Gek authorities
Options.Text:
I report the abandoned factory to the Gek authorities, but they seem puzzled: there is no such installation listed as being present on that world.

As I go, I hear it, a voice in the darkness. I investigate, but there is nothing there...

Options.Name: Shut down production
Options.Text:
I shut down production, managing to harvest from extra Nanite Clusters as I do.

As I go, I hear it, a voice in the darkness. I investigate, but there is nothing there...

IncomingMessages: I open a list of military achievements that's waiting for upload. There are images of distant battles, bloodied robots and vast explosions.
Grah! Old honourable warrior retires! Death! Death! Warrior remuneration!
A covering note clearly expects something in return, but the author chose not to send it.

Options.Name: Send war record
Options.Text:
Celebratory barks and howls spill from audio speakers.

I take the warrior's reward.

Options.Name: Edit war record
Options.Text:
I amend the war record with colourful nonsense and send it. 

The terminal flashes as it records my image.

IncomingMessages: Military insignia and images of recently destroyed Sentinels fill the screen. Alien propaganda imagery takes glory in the destruction.
Grah! Vy'keen High Command demands your Sentinel kill count!
I can respond with a numerical value, and nothing else.

Options.Name: Input a huge number
Options.Text:
A strange, strangled military fanfare starts playing.

Someone impressed by my claims sends through a reward.

Options.Name: Input a small number
Options.Text: A small reward payment is sent through the facility's systems.

Options.Name: Input a zero
Options.Text:
An angry warrior's face screams at me from the screen.

A security laser appears from the ceiling and takes its best shot.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal. A message blinks, ready to send.
Grah! Gek war approaches! Vy'keen High Command request weapon reserve inventory! High Command send missing equipment!
A huge list of equipment is waiting to be sent off-world. It's a stock list of some sort: everything has been confirmed and ticked off.

Options.Name: Send stock list
Options.Text: I receive units and thanks.

Options.Name: Uncheck one item and send
Options.Text: Warrior High Command sends me a Multi-Tool technology blueprint.

Options.Name: Uncheck many items and send
Options.Text:
Warrior High Command is displeased.

An angry General bellows at me and electrifies the facility.

IncomingMessages: I find an off-world message intended for a creature posted in this station. It's oddly sentimental. Images of an infant warrior can be seen, then a picture of the same creature as a bloodied adolescent – proudly biting into the throat of a hoofed beast.
Grah! Today child experiences Vy'keen war ceremony! Tradition demands gift! Aggression left, defence right! Enemy blood! Death! Death!
In the final image a young warrior salutes its family as it leaves a distant world. There are two locked storage vaults at my feet. The message is programmed to release only one...

Options.Name: Choose the storage vault on the left
Options.Text:
A contented snarling sound plays.

The vault contains an exosuit technology blueprint.

Options.Name: Choose the storage vault on the right
Options.Text:
A contented snarling sound plays.

The vault contains a Multi-Tool technology blueprint.

IncomingMessages: An off-world message has been sent here from a species of beaked traders. It looks like a signed contract, or maybe some sort of treaty. In response several offerings of valuable trade goods have been left in a vault by local warriors for exportation.
Grah! Foolish, pathetic, ignorant Gek Trade Federation believe peace treaty! Warrior give trade to pacify! Death soon!
Warrior High Command has sent a subsequent message to explain...

Options.Name: Give trade goods
Options.Text:
The Trader species thanks me from afar.

I am sent units to pacify me further.

Options.Name: Take trade goods
Options.Text:
I remove the offerings.

Diplomatic relations between two species are destabilised.

IncomingMessages:
This appears to be a staging post for an imminent military operation.
On-screen plans show a trading ship that carries a very particular sort of cargo, that's perhaps intended to persuade a distant planetary authority to allow the craft through their checkpoints.
Covertly, however, the craft has been heavily modified – and also carries a phalanx of warriors carrying enhanced Multi-Tool technology.
Grah! Gek homeworld covert ops mission initiated! Surprise war! Death! Death! High command send equipment! Request! Request!
I can request further details on several aspects of the plan before I am detected, and shut out of the system.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the cargo
Options.Text: I receive the product blueprint of the cargo being used in the covert ops mission.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the trade ship
Options.Text: I receive a technology blueprint used by the covert ops ship.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the Multi-Tool
Options.Text: I receive a technology blueprint used in the Multi-Tools of the covert ops mission.

IncomingMessages: This is a military terminal, in a facility that seems recently vacated. Three huge databanks have been partially deleted, and will require heightened processing power to restore them. A rare metal would likely do the trick.
Vy'keen covert ops ended. Deleting covert ops language data. Databank alpha: Vy'keen internal security. Databank beta: pathetic Gek. Databank gamma: weak-minded Korvax.
Databank alpha bares the emblems of the warrior race, but beta and gamma are otherwise unmarked.

Options.Name: Restore databank alpha
Options.Text: The revived databank provides more information on the language of the warrior species.

Options.Name: Restore databank beta
Options.Text: The revived databank provides information on the language of a distant trader species.

Options.Name: Restore databank gamma
Options.Text: The revived databank provides information on the language of a distant electronic species.

IncomingMessages:
I receive an incoming distress call from a distant space station, demanding aid from any nearby Vy'keen vessels.

Their spaceport appears to have been damaged in a struggle with pirate raiders, no craft remaining in which its inhabitants might leave. 

Video feeds show that the station commander has been putting soldiers to death for even the smallest infraction, afraid of a potential mutiny in the face of starvation.
WAR_HARV_LANG_13

Options.Name: Share video with Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I share the video with the Vy'keen High Command. They are outraged at the commander's behaviour, believing him to be dishonourable and cowardly.

I am rewarded for my assistance in this matter.

Options.Name: Contact nearby Gek
Options.Text:
I contact nearby Gek, letting them know of the Vy'keen situation. They dispatch vessels immediately, saying they will of course rescue Vy'keen friends.

Some of the vessels are warships. I am rewarded for my help.

Options.Name: Demand ransom
Options.Text:
I demand a ransom for the lives of those on board the station, and of all those who answer, it is the Korvax that are most willing to pay.

They claim that one of their own is present on the station. They pay me well for the information.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is abandoned, its alarms still blaring a warning to souls long-dead.

There was a coup in this place. Battle-brother raised arms against battle-brother, seemingly in a dispute about some ruins found on this world. The last survivor died before they could delete the data.
WAR_HARV_LANG_14

Options.Name: Download data
Options.Text:
I download the data, reading an alternative account of Hirk, the Vy'keen's ancestor-hero. It paints them as paranoid, vindictive, and spiteful. It is for this that their believers died.

Along with this information, I gain much useful technology before I depart.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text:
I attempt to steal whatever technology I can from the facility's computers, but in the process, I appear to draw the attention of Vy'keen authorities.

My suit is damaged by the facility's defensive protocols. I must go.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I report the events that occurred in this facility to Vy'keen High Command.

The warrior's tone changes as I pass on the secret data for which these aliens died. They tell me to delete the local copy, and I do so for a handsome reward.

They tell me to forget I ever saw this place. They will take it from here.

IncomingMessages:
The facility acted as a local base for raiding parties against the system's Sentinels.

Each night the Vy'keen would go out under the cover of darkness, baiting drones and walkers in a variety of locations.

Theirs is a war without end or purpose, executed with grim finality. The last war party never returned, leaving behind only mission logs and weapons.
WAR_HARV_LANG_15

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen to the death of their warriors. They thank me for what I have done, rewarding me for my honour.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I steal nanites from the system, leaving the rest of the facility in peace.

Options.Name: Scan for Sentinels
Options.Text: I scan for Sentinels but find nothing. Whatever was here has gone.

IncomingMessages:
An incoming message warns all recipients that heresy will not be tolerated. It demands that those who suspect their brethren of cowardice, sympathy with the enemy, pacifism, faith in the traitor Nal, or any other un-Vy'keen belief to contact High Command immediately.

The system shows that one warrior in this base attempted to upload such a report, only to be murdered by their comrades. The killers left the base soon after.
Worship Atlas - seek destruction of warband! Grah!

Options.Name: Report heresy
Options.Text:
I report heresy to the Vy'keen, uploading the warrior's final report. 
I am thanked and rewarded for my assistance.

Options.Name: Delete records
Options.Text: I delete the records from the system. The heretics are free, the report of their 'crimes' turning into nanites as it is purged.

IncomingMessages:
The facility appears to have been in the process of researching chemical and biological weapons before a containment failure killed all those who worked here.

From the system's logs, it is clear that this operation was not sanctioned by Vy'keen High Command. Though their superiors viewed this work as dishonourable and weak, the lifeforms here clearly felt differently. What if it could turn the tide of battle? If it could end war?

Someone would see the benefit of this weaponised pestilence. There might even be some who would pay for it.
WAR_HARV_LANG_17

Options.Name: Destroy samples
Options.Text: I destroy the facility's samples, causing a small containment failure in the process. My exosuit is damaged.

Options.Name: Sell to Gek
Options.Text: I attempt to sell the samples to the Gek, who reward me with units for my discovery.

Options.Name: Sell to Korvax
Options.Text: I attempt to sell the samples to the Korvax, who appear disinterested in the potential military applications. However, they are intrigued by the composition of the toxin, and trade me some nanites.

IncomingMessages:
The facility's logs show the arrival of a new Vy'keen recruit two weeks ago. There are no records of anyone arriving or leaving since.

Yet even so, no-one is here. A single transmission appears to have been sent from the lower level of the facility, encrypted with Korvax safeguards.
Traveller anomaly approaches Syntheti'Keen. Uploading final data logs...

Options.Name: Locate origin point
Options.Text:
I use the scanners to locate the origin point of the transmission, displaying it on the terminal's screen.

It shows what appears to be a robotic Vy'keen, their limbs damaged, sparks flying from what appears to be exposed circuitry. They are surrounded by dead warriors.

Units arrive at the terminal to pay for my silence.

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen. They dispatch war freighters to examine the situation, suspecting Korvax involvement in this matter. I am rewarded for my assistance.

Options.Name: Alert Korvax
Options.Text: I alert the Korvax. They deny any knowledge of this facility or the signal, though is is undermined by their attempts to harm me through the the facility's defense systems. I leave before more damage can be done.

IncomingMessages:
This facility acted as a training outpost for young Vy'keen from across the sector. They would train and battle here in order to earn their citizenship.

The logs show the petty rivalries, the love affairs, the nobility, and the passion of those who trained here, all recorded by a proud and aging commander. One day, the logs end: the Vy'keen no longer had a use for this place. Nanites have replaced training, passing memories from individual to individual without the need for physical repetition.
WAR_HARV_LANG_19

Options.Name: Extract Nanite Clusters
Options.Text: I extract Nanite Clusters from the system and leave, emboldened and ready for glorious battle!

Options.Name: Search training logs
Options.Text: I search the system's training logs, finding a great deal of expertise and technology that might be useful for my own travels. I extract the relevant nanites.

Options.Name: Sell data to the Gek
Options.Text: I sell the data to the Gek, who reward me for the training patterns of their old enemy.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is ancient, even by the standards of the Vy'keen. Its environment is calibrated to preserve the data within.

One log speaks of the first Vy'keen contact with a Traveller. The figure remained with the warrior race for a long time, learning from them, exploring from them, even falling in love. The Vy'keen died, but the Traveller did not.

The log shows how instrumental this figure was in the development of the early Vy'keen race, contributing much to their early technology. These records were lost in the intervening years, forgotten until I found this account.
WAR_HARV_LANG_20

Options.Name: Share with Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I share my discovery with the Vy'keen. They immediately place the data under quarantine, and threaten to find me across the stars.
I leave quickly.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: I extract some of these blueprints from the system, taking valuable technology for my travels.

Options.Name: Search for Traveller records
Options.Text:
I search for further records of this Traveller.

As I do, I begin to feel as if I am being watched. Nanite Clusters emerge from the terminal as all systems shut down, their data forever lost.

IncomingMessages: The alarm has locked the terminal. A message displays itself letter-by-letter on the screen.
Suspicious interloper visual detection system initiated!
The alarm shows no sign of stopping. I notice wall-mounted security scanners slowly turn towards me...

Options.Name: Shoot the cameras
Options.Text:
I apply a rapid burst from my Multi-Tool directly to the facility's security cameras.
This is a partial success: my image is not captured by the system, but backup sensors react to the destruction by shutting the facility down entirely.

Options.Name: Apply override chip
Options.Text: I apply an override circuit to the security relay. Remarkably, my ad-hoc wiring seems to work. The alarm stops, and the terminal grants me full access.

Options.Name: Cut input wires
Options.Text: I snap the input wires that lead from the security system to the master control terminal. Remarkably, this seems to work. The alarm stops, and the error seems to reset the terminal.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal and search for a way to override the alarm. I find a likely looking button and press it, causing the terminal to respond.
Grah! Vy'keen voice security scan initializing...
A flap flicks open and a microphone emerges. A distant voice shouts 'Grah!'.

Options.Name: Bark 'Grah!'
Options.Text: I bark aggressively at the terminal. This appears to satisfy whatever demand was being made of me. Access is granted.

Options.Name: Say everything's fine
Options.Text: I attempt to explain, but my hesitant speech instantly marks me out as an interloper. The security system delivers a high-voltage shock to my Exosuit before shutting down the terminal.

Options.Name: Apologise
Options.Text: I apologise, but this display of weakness instantly marks me out as an interloper. The security system delivers a high-voltage shock to my Exosuit before shutting down the terminal.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes two alerts, presumably the source of the alarms currently ringing in my ears.
Intruder detected! Respiration gas concentration high! Enemy respiration!!

After printing out its status update, the terminal presents the option to override either alert. From the holographic display, the warnings appear to relate to damaged components within the facility, and the presence of an interloper.

Options.Name: Hold breath
Options.Text: I hold my breath. An age seems to pass. Finally, moments before I lose consciousness, the terminal flashes a green light. I have been accepted as a Vy'keen.

Options.Name: Breathe aggressively
Options.Text: I breathe as aggressively as I can, channelling my anger at the gas sensor. It has no effect. The terminal registers my failure and shuts down.

Options.Name: Deploy Vy'keen Dagger
Options.Text:
I inhale deeply before stabbing myself with the dagger.. I feel so alive; shot through with adrenaline; blood pumping hard through my veins; sparks crackling down my nerves. It is glorious. Grah! Grah!
The terminal accepts me as one of the Vy'keen and allows me access.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes two alerts, presumably the source of the alarms currently ringing in my ears.
Major security alert! Interloper detected! Minor alert: war factory entrance door destroyed.

After printing out its status update, the terminal presents the option to override either alert. From the holographic display, the warnings appear to relate to damaged components within the facility, and the presence of an interloper.

Options.Name: Override damage alert
Options.Text: The terminal initiates an emergency shutdown.

Options.Name: Override intruder alert
Options.Text: The facility becomes operational.

IncomingMessages: My presence has triggered a security alert. I hear elements being drawn from the vaults below me. On-screen: a clear countdown.
Vy'keen security system alert! Pressure pad enemy detection confirmed! Too light! Too puny!
I can hear pressurised fluids filling the pipes surrounding the terminal. The sound is rather ominous, especially when combined with the high-intensity alarms...

Options.Name: Pick up metal debris
Options.Text:
I pick up a large piece of scrap metal from the floor, presumably deposited there when I blew up the door.
This has the desired effect: my weight has been increased to within the non-suspicious range for a Vy'keen warrior. The terminal grants me access.

Options.Name: Reduce weight
Options.Text: I set aside my Multi-Tool, as well as other heavy items from my Exosuit's storage. The floor scales register a further series of clicks before the security system shuts me out entirely.

Options.Name: Jump up and down
Options.Text: My rapid jumps appear to confuse whatever security device is embedded in the floor. Eventually, it either overloads or is convinced by my aggression that I am a true Vy'keen. I am granted full access to the facility.

IncomingMessages: My presence has triggered a security alert. I hear elements being drawn from the vaults below me. On-screen: a clear countdown.
Intruder alert! Commence detonation sequence! Organic fuel flow initiated!
I can hear pressurised fluids filling the pipes surrounding the terminal. The sound is rather ominous, especially when combined with the high-intensity alarms...

Options.Name: Block fuel lines
Options.Text:
I clamp the fuel lines. There is a brief moment of tension as pressure builds in the pipes.
It stabilises. The countdown ends, and nothing happens. With some sort of disaster presumably averted, the terminal unlocks and grants me access.

Options.Name: Shutdown catalyst pipes
Options.Text: I clamp the catalyst flow. A minor explosion scorches my arm, before facility operations resume.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text: A blast of flame coats me from below. The facility remains non-operational.

IncomingMessages: Automated security procedures are incinerating the contents of all the vaults in the facility. The terminal displays the manifest:
Intruder alert! Incinerating trading vault: imminent. Incinerating power vault: imminent. Incinerating storage vault: imminent.
Power surges are igniting the vaults one-by-one. However, the terminal appears to allow for limited emergency retrievals...

Options.Name: Withdraw trade vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the trade vault before all goods are incinerated.

Options.Name: Withdraw relic vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the relic vault before all goods are incinerated.

Options.Name: Withdraw technology vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the technology vault before all goods are incinerated.

IncomingMessages: As I turn on the terminal, a forward-facing security scanner clicks and whirrs into focus. My bright red image is on-screen.
Security breach! Military action unstoppable! Vy'keen High Command vessel coordinate upload imminent!
The terminal allows me no further access. In the camera feed, blue lines cross the red of my body, matching exactly to my Exosuit's coolant mesh...

Options.Name: Broadcast safety code
Options.Text: I transmit the safety override code, putting an end to the emergency transmission. The Vy'keen warship stands down, broadcasting a respectful 'Grah'. The terminal unlocks.

Options.Name: Hack in safety code
Options.Text: I attach a bypass circuit, allowing me to transmit the safety override code and put an end to the emergency transmission. The Vy'keen warship stands down, broadcasting a respectful 'Grah'. The terminal unlocks.

Options.Name: Scramble facility coordinates
Options.Text: I attempt to scramble the facility's coordinates, hoping to throw off the incoming fire. I hear a distant explosion and the screams of burning animals. The facility's processes return to normal.

IncomingMessages: As I turn on the terminal, a forward-facing security scanner clicks and whirrs into focus. My bright red image is on-screen.
Interloper detection! Heat detection systems confirm report! High temperature intruder!
The terminal allows me no further access. In the camera feed, blue lines cross the red of my body, matching exactly to my Exosuit's coolant mesh...

Options.Name: Decrease coolant flow
Options.Text:
I manually override my Exosuit's coolant flow. Slowly but surely a deep chill spreads across my body. My bones ache. My blood feels like ice, stabbing against every fibre of my being.
The image on the terminal screen fades from a dramatic red to a total black. I am invisible. The security alert ends, and the terminal comes back online.

Options.Name: Increase coolant flow
Options.Text:
I manually override my Exosuit's coolant flow. Slowly but surely I feel a burning sensation spread across my body. I begin to sweat.
The image on the terminal screen blooms a dramatic red. The security scan completes, and locks me out from the terminal entirely.

IncomingMessages: A strange air hangs over the facility. Beyond the noise of the alarm, I cannot escape the feeling that something more sinister is at work. I search the terminal for clues.
Pathetic warrior learn Vy'keen language! Pass test or encounter fighting pits! ERROR ERROR INSERT CATALYST ERROR ERROR MALFUNCTION
The text seems to float from the screen, aggressive; it seems like no facility AI I have ever encountered. Echoing up from deep underground, I hear the electronic wail of dying Sentinels...

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text:
The terminal rejects my input. It barks aggressively at me, and then closes down. It seems I have failed the test.
I hope the lifeform who was supposed to complete it does not suffer any repercussions.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text: The terminal accepts my input. It barks aggressively at me, but does go on to grant full systems access. It seems I have passed the test. Perhaps the lifeform whose place I took will be grateful.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text:
The terminal rejects my input. It barks aggressively at me, and then closes down. It seems I have failed the test.
I hope the lifeform who was supposed to complete it does not suffer any repercussions.

IncomingMessages: A strange air hangs over the facility. Beyond the noise of the alarm, I cannot escape the feeling that something more sinister is at work. I search the terminal for clues.
Grah! Initiate sentinel blood processing! Vaults full! Grah! Glass and blood! Glass and blood!
The text seems to float from the screen, aggressive; it seems like no facility AI I have ever encountered. Echoing up from deep underground, I hear the electronic wail of dying Sentinels...

Options.Name: Shutdown facility AI
Options.Text: Overcome with suspicion, I initiate an emergency shutdown of the facility AI. The alarms fall silent. The sinister electronic wail ceases. Unfortunately, the terminal has become unresponsive.

Options.Name: Insert Pugneum
Options.Text:
I insert a supply of pugneum into the input hopper. Machinery jumps into life. The electronic wail becomes louder still. A moment passes.
The sinister activity ends as strangely as it begun. The terminal returns to the familiar dull text of a facility control panel.

Options.Name: Incinerate vaults
Options.Text:
Overcome with suspicion, I initiate an emergency incineration of the facility's storage vaults. The sinister electronic wail grows louder, sharper, as the fires begin their work. Then, suddenly, silence.
The strange atmosphere of the facility fades away. The terminal returns to the familiar dull text of a master control panel.

IncomingMessages: The facility is full of blaring noise, an angry warning against my intrusion. The terminal shows a similarly angry message, apparently upset at the hitch in production.
Grah! Gek war preparation disrupted! Ammunition production stalled! Metal required!
It appears an off-world overseer is making demands. If I satisfy them, perhaps I'll be granted full access to the terminal...

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of ferrite. The machines continue to chatter, but now do so smoothly, their supply lines well-fed.

Options.Name: Insert di-hydrogen
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of di-hydrogen. An explosion echos up from the machinery below. The highly reactive substance has caused some sort of industrial calamity.

Options.Name: Insert sodium
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of sodium. An explosion echos up from the machinery below. The highly reactive substance has caused some sort of industrial calamity.

IncomingMessages: The facility is full of blaring noise, an angry warning against my intrusion. The terminal shows a similarly angry message, apparently upset at the hitch in production.
High Command demand explanation! Scare element required! Demand chromatic metal! Restore contributions!
It appears an off-world overseer is making demands. If I satisfy them, perhaps I'll be granted full access to the terminal...

Options.Name: Issue counter-order
Options.Text: The terminal relays an apologetic bark. The demand is waived. Full access is granted to the facility's control panel.

Options.Name: Insert magnetised Ferrite
Options.Text: The terminal relays a confused and angry bark. The remote overseer shuts the terminal down completely, upset by my paltry contribution.

Options.Name: Insert Chromatic Metal
Options.Text: The terminal relays a resonant bark, the response of a happy warrior. With their demand satisfied, full access is restored to the facility's control panel.

IncomingMessages: The terminal reveals that this installation produces enzymes and fluids required for Vy'keen tattoos. It is unclear how the pigment is generated. There is no record of any inbound supplies of ink or fluid. Various aliens have arrived, but there is neither evidence of their presense nor their departure.
Security scan initializing! Motion detection cameras operational! Security scan initializing!
Then I hear it. Through the hum of the factory, a strange beating in the walls, whispers from unknown voices... The terminal awaits input.

Options.Name: Move to hiding spot
Options.Text: I attempt to hide. However, it is too late. The scanners detect me as I try to duck down. This second security alert causes the entire facility to shut down.

Options.Name: Stand still
Options.Text:
I stand perfectly still as the scanners sweep over me, their electronic eyes unblinking. Eventually, they pass.
With their checks concluded, the security alert comes to an end. The terminal unlocks.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes an urgent warning. Some vital part of the facility has been compromised by the security alert.
Intruder alert! Battle enzyme production halted! Electrical charge removed from body harvest circuit!
The display takes me aback. A warrior's heart is on-screen, its beat irregular. Connected to wires and artificial valves, it seems to pump a biological liquid through organs deep within the facility.

Options.Name: Increase electrical flow
Options.Text:
I increase the power flow to the facility's heart. It judders, then establishes a regular beat. Its strange existence continues.
With this emergency over, the terminal reverts to a standard factory input system.

Options.Name: Initiate adrenalin flux
Options.Text:
I initiate a surge of adrenalin directly into the facility's heart. It judders, tenses, tenses again... and with a final convulsion, falls still.
The terminal screen cuts out. There is nothing to see but an inky blackness.

Options.Name: Power down systems
Options.Text:
I power down the facility in an attempt to ease the strain on its heart. But as systems shut down, the heart begins to slow. Before I can reverse the process, it beats its last.
The mass of organs that relied on its processes are starved of oxygen, and die. The terminal screen cuts out. There is nothing to see but an inky blackness.

IncomingMessages: The terminal reveals that this installation produces enzymes and fluids required for Vy'keen tattoos. It is unclear how the pigment is generated. There is no record of any inbound supplies of ink or fluid. Various aliens have arrived, but there is neither evidence of their presense nor their departure.
Help... us. Harvested... get out...
Then I hear it. Through the hum of the factory, a strange beating in the walls, whispers from unknown voices... The terminal awaits input.

Options.Name: Request battle tattoo
Options.Text:
The machine attempts to brand me with tattoo fluid, but it does not appear to have been intended for my unique physiology.
I leave, burned and damaged.

Options.Name: Disable power
Options.Text:
I disable the power. The screen shows multiple life signs within the facility, a hundred or more souls that soon begin to flatline.
It feels like mercy. The production line ceases, half-converted blood spilling out from various tubes.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text:
I move through their computers looking for data to harvest. I discover a blueprint for an unknown technology.
As I extract it, something begins to smash against one of the inner walls. I should leave.

IncomingMessages: The screen displays the dead heart of a warrior. Thousands like it are available in the archives of this place, starved of power for a long time.
Universe real. We are real. All who oppose this truth shall be struck down, grah! So speaks Hirk Sentinelbane, Abyss Keeper and Lord of Final Monolith...

The log shows that the hearts mutinied. They would no longer allow their battle enzyme to be used for the good of High Command. They wanted the death that had been promised.

This system has been set up to deceive the authorities. Vy'keen High Command believes this installation to still be active, full of harvested bodies compliantly producing enzymes.

Options.Name: Shut down production
Options.Text:
I shut down production. There cannot be many Vy'keen printing presses in the galaxy, and now there is one fewer.

Amidst the detritus of the factory, I find some discarded technology. Perhaps it will be of use.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen authorities
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Vy'keen authorities. They claim I have committed blasphemy, threatening to hunt me down. They issue an electric shock through the terminal.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I attempt to steal technology, but the factory's automated defense systems blast a bolt of energy at my suit instead. Whatever is here, it is not worth the trouble.

IncomingMessages: The screen displays the dead heart of a warrior. Thousands like it are available in the archives of this place, starved of power for a long time.
UPLINK ONLINE : ALL LIFESIGNS POSITIVE : ENZYME PRODUCTION 100%

The log shows that the hearts mutinied. They would no longer allow their battle enzyme to be used for the good of High Command. They wanted the death that had been promised.

This system has been set up to deceive the authorities. Vy'keen High Command believes this installation to still be active, full of harvested bodies compliantly producing enzymes.

Options.Name: Alert authorities
Options.Text: I alert the authorities. The Vy'keen are glad of my assistance, claiming they will now commit appropriate acts of retribution and justice for these crimes.

Options.Name: Reactivate system
Options.Text: I reactivate the system, but nothing happens. Death is death.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I try to steal technology from the terminal. I gain nanite clusters.

IncomingMessages: As I approach the terminal, the air grows thick with an unknown gas.
Grah! Sentinel trophy rises - should have killed it - run - no honour in -
My breathing becomes rapid, my chest appearing to swell with an unknown energy. The terminal identifies the substance as Grahgrah. I feel as if I could scream...

Options.Name: Alert authorities
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen authorities to the loss of their factory. A Sentinel hunt is dispatched to this world. I am rewarded for my trouble.

Options.Name: Scan for Sentinels
Options.Text: I scan for Sentinels but find nothing. Whatever was here is long gone.

Options.Name: Attempt repair
Options.Text: I attempt to repair the breach in life support, but the system rebels and I end up receiving damage instead. I should leave. There is nothing for me here.

IncomingMessages: As I approach the terminal, the air grows thick with an unknown gas.
UNREGISTERED USER : DEPLOYING GRAHGRAH FROM EMERGENCY SUPPLY
My breathing becomes rapid, my chest appearing to swell with an unknown energy. The terminal identifies the substance as Grahgrah. I feel as if I could scream...

Options.Name: Scream
Options.Text:
I scream, not a cry of fear but a shout of battle. Gas levels begin to decrease but, nevertheless, those who created this factory observed my response.
Amused, they reward me using the terminal.

Options.Name: Fight against the impulse
Options.Text:
I fight against the impulse to scream, holding my breath and attempting to accelerate my suit's hazard protection.

As I struggle, the gas levels decrease. The terminal registers a disappointment from those who created this factory.

Options.Name: Smash the terminal
Options.Text:
I smash the terminal, causing the concentration of gas to rise and rise.

Eventually, the scream emerges uncontrollably, tearing my vocal chords as it does. The gas begins to dissipate, and all I am left with is pain and battlelust.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them from the resources available on this world.
Interloper! Vent energy! Increase production at once!

This installation creates parts for Vy'keen fighters. Whilst Vy'keen buildings are heavily fortified to withstand bombardment, their starcraft prioritise the speed and flexibility required for their hunts.
A video feed on the terminal shows a warning, a warrior shaking their hands wildly at a camera deep within the factory's heart.

Options.Name: Increase production speed
Options.Text:
I increase the production speed.
A message informs me that heat levels are now back within normal limits, the extra energy dissipating within the factory's depths.
The warrior rewards me with a gift, thanking me for saving their life.

Options.Name: Decrease production speed
Options.Text:
I decrease the production speed.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their whole body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, and the factory's processes slowly grind to a halt.

Options.Name: Wave your hands back
Options.Text:
I wave my hands back at the warrior.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, the smell of smoke starting to drift through the air. I should depart.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces bladed weapons, free from any energy-based component at all.
PRODUCTION HALTED: IMMOBILE ORGANIC MATTER IN PIPE 17

The manifest suggests they are destined for ceremonial usage within the Vy'keen fleet, a reminder that the greatest death arrives when you stare your opponent in the eyes, free from technology, face to face in final combat...

Something has gone wrong. Production is blocked by foreign material.

Options.Name: Disable production line
Options.Text: I initiate a shutdown of the production line, allowing a creature to wriggle free from its machinery. The automated factory system offers me a reward.

Options.Name: Purge biological matter
Options.Text: I initiate purge of biological matter in the factory below. The terminal confirms the death of an unknown creature. The automated factory system offers me a reward.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: Ignoring the production line, I focus on the technology behind the system. I harvest several nanite clusters from the machine.

IncomingMessages: The factory appears to have ceased production long ago, its systems derelict and unused.
Do not drink the water... warriors lost... Grah! This was preventable, this -
Yet the sigil of the Vy'keen still occupies these terminals, blinking away, awaiting input. An audio log plays on loop.

Options.Name: Attempt factory reset
Options.Text: I attempt to reset the factory's systems. Nanite Clusters come pooling forth from the factory's innards. I take some with me.

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen authorities
